results.title: The Races
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia, Kit Denton, John Shaw and Daro Gunzberg
results.brief_description: A compilation of three racing films: “A Race of Horses”, “Pace” and “Kew Howard, Saddler”. See strappers, handlers, trainers, jockeys and vets in action and hear one of Australia’s last saddlers reminisce about his craft.

results.title: The Race for space
results.creator_credit: Wolper Productions and David L. Wolper
results.brief_description: A history of efforts to reach out into space, the development of rockets and the space race between USSR and the USA. The work of the Russian mathematician Konstantin Tsiolkovsky in 1930, Dr Robert Godard, an American in 1913, and the early experiments of the German Rocket Society. Hitler and the development of the V2. The capture of German scientists by American and Russian troops and the subsequent developments leading to the launching of Satellites Sputnik I and II. Early American mistakes with the Vanguard Rocket and their final success with Explorer I some months after the Russians.

results.title: The Rabies threat
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description: Shows the problems caused by the animal disease rabies, and outlines the work of the Animal Quarantine Service which functions to keep out of Australia all exotic animal diseases.

results.title: The Rabbit in Australia
results.brief_description: The introduction of the rabbit into Australia and the resultant long battle to contol it. Notes how the rabbit feeds, breeds and survives in different parts of Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: The RAAF aircraft apprentice scheme
results.creator_credit: Australia. Royal Air Force. Films Advisory Bureau, Australia. Royal Australian Air Force and Geoffrey Thompson
results.brief_description: Shows opportunities for boys to take up trades in the RAAF. They begin a 5 year course at Wagga (NSW). Then according to aptitude and ambition, they go on to learn care and repair of ground transport, aero engines, aircraft, armaments, radio and electronic equipment. The film stresses the chances for a full life in training, higher study and promotion.

results.title: The Quinkins
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Paul R. Gagne
results.brief_description: A group of Aborigines combined their talents to create the pictures and sound for this traditional tale of conflict between the Imnims and the Timaras in Dreamtime. Uses the illustrations from the book of the same name by Dick Roughsey and Percy Trezise.

results.title: The Quiller memorandum
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Ivan Foxwell and Michael Anderson
results.brief_description: George Segal stars as British intelligence agent Quiller. His mission is to investigate a Neo Nazi organisation located in Berlin and headed by a ruthless fanatic, Oktober (Max von Sydow). It is mission fraught with danger, as Quiller is informed by his boss Pol (Alec Guinness), that two other agents have already lost their lives. It is for this reason that Pol does not send the protection of agents Weng (Robert Helpmann) and Hengel (Peter Carsten), and Quiller quickly finds himself the prisoner of Oktober. With no-one to help him, Quiller must place his trust in a beautiful school teacher Inge (Senta Berger), and utilise all the skills he has been taught if he is to escape. Based on the novel “The Berlin memorandum” by Adam Hall (Elleston Trevor). Screenplay by Harold Pinter.

results.title: The Quiet war: Vietnam
results.brief_description: An account of the guerilla fighting in South Vietnam and its effect on the lives of the people. The division of Vietnam, the North to the Communists, the South to the Vietnamese, is seen through the eyes of a farming family. They are accustomed to the “quiet war” waged by the Viet Cong guerillas and the South Vietnam Government headed by President Ngo Dinh Diem. In a country of steaming jungles infested with guerillas, constant vigilance is necessary, only armed patrols venturing out at night. The safest place is by the river which forms the border, in the international control area. The Seven Year Old Republic is butressed by the free world to stem the flow of Communist domination in South-east Asia. (please note synopsis written 1964)

results.title: The Quiet room
results.creator_credit: Smile Productions, Vertigo Productions, Fandango, Marvel Movies, SBS Independent, Domenico Procacci and Rolf De Heer
results.brief_description: A seven-year-old girl’s perception of adulthood is portrayed through the marriage breakdown of her parents. Withdrawing into silence as a protest and protection against her parents’ constant fighting, the nameless girl reveals her thoughts through an internal monologue which mixes childishness and vulnerability with emotional sophistication and strength. Her only refuge is her blue-walled room, an exaggerated fantasyland of goldfish, Barbie dolls and toys, where she can remember happier days. de Heer’s acute insights into the young girl’s mentality and speech patterns through his innovative use of sound and silence is combined with a highly stylised mise-en-scene, to convey the hermetic insularity of her childhood world. Like ‘Bad Boy Bubby’, ‘The Quiet Room’ explores the dysfunctional behaviour of parents and the lasting effect it has on their children. Cast includes: Celine O’Leary, Paul Blackwell, Chole Ferguson and Phoebe Ferguson.

results.title: The Quiet racket
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Gerald Potterton
results.brief_description: An amusing tale of a man who feels the common urge to escape the city’s noise for a weekend of quiet in the hills beyond. Made without words, but with a variety of other sounds, urban and rural, this film tracks our hero to his haven of non-peace. He finds the countryside not as unspoiled and uncrowded as the poets proclaim, nor is the ‘bosom of nature’ entirely without rocks.
